flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction: L7580 is a great multifunction printer from HP. Here we will discover what's inside the printer and remove its sensors and DC motors.
guide.introduction_rendered:
L7580 is a great multifunction printer from HP. Here we will discover what's inside the printer and remove its sensors and DC motors.

Tools
  • T8 Torx Screwdriver
  • T20 Torx Screwdriver
  • Tweezer
  • Wire cutter/stripper

lines.text: Remove the three T8 Torx screws from the paper feeder.
lines.text_raw: Remove the three T8 Torx screws from the paper feeder.

lines.text: Lift the white surface to reveal the two notches.
lines.text_raw: Lift the white surface to reveal the two notches.

lines.text: Push the notches to detach the paper feeder mechanism.
lines.text_raw: Push the notches to detach the paper feeder mechanism.

lines.text: After removing the paper feeder, you will notice the slotted opto switch.
lines.text_raw: After removing the paper feeder, you will notice the slotted opto switch.

lines.text: Remove the back cover to demount cable jacks.
lines.text_raw: Remove the back cover to demount cable jacks.

lines.text: Pull and detach the paper feeder mechanism.
lines.text_raw: Pull and detach the paper feeder mechanism.

lines.text: Remove the T8 Torx screws from the right cover.
lines.text_raw: Remove the T8 Torx screws from the right cover.

lines.text: You will see the feeder's mechanics after removing the cover.
lines.text_raw: You will see the feeder's mechanics after removing the cover.

lines.text: Remove the top cover, and here is the first DC motor and its encoder.
lines.text_raw: Remove the top cover, and here is the first DC motor and its encoder.

lines.text: Pull the scanner cover up to detach it from the main body. Then, remove the T8 Torx screws around the scanner window.
lines.text_raw: Pull the scanner cover up to detach it from the main body. Then, remove the T8 Torx screws around the scanner window.

lines.text: Remove the control panel by pulling it.
lines.text_raw: Remove the control panel by pulling it.

lines.text: Finally, remove the inner layer of the control panel by forcing the notches.
lines.text_raw: Finally, remove the inner layer of the control panel by forcing the notches.

lines.text: Remove the flat cable from the control panel.
lines.text_raw: Remove the flat cable from the control panel.

lines.text: Remove the T8 Torx screws to see what's inside the control panel.
lines.text_raw: Remove the T8 Torx screws to see what's inside the control panel.

lines.text: Then, we will see the 4 layers of the control panel.
lines.text_raw: Then, we will see the 4 layers of the control panel.

lines.text: Remove the two T8 screws to detach the scanner cover.
lines.text_raw: Remove the two T8 screws to detach the scanner cover.

lines.text: Lift the cover up to reveal the scanner mechanism.
lines.text_raw: Lift the cover up to reveal the scanner mechanism.

lines.text: And we have our second DC motor and encoder. Plus, a carrier mechanism.
lines.text_raw: And we have our second DC motor and encoder. Plus, a carrier mechanism.

lines.text: Remove the scan head's top cover by pressing the two notches on the back.
lines.text_raw: Remove the scan head's top cover by pressing the two notches on the back.

lines.text: Remove the T8 screws of the circuit board.
lines.text_raw: Remove the T8 screws of the circuit board.

lines.text: Here is the scanner sensor and the objective.
lines.text_raw: Here is the scanner sensor and the objective.

lines.text: Remove all the screws from the back, including the ones inside the 3 covers.
lines.text_raw: Remove all the screws from the back, including the ones inside the 3 covers.

lines.text: Remove the two screws from the top of the cartridge-change cover.
lines.text_raw: Remove the two screws from the top of the cartridge-change cover.

lines.text: Detach the two side covers by pulling them.
lines.text_raw: Detach the two side covers by pulling them.

lines.text: Detach the back cover.
lines.text_raw: Detach the back cover.

lines.text: Remove the 4 screws from the both hinges.
lines.text_raw: Remove the 4 screws from the both hinges.

lines.text: The hinges can pop up suddenly, so be careful.
lines.text_raw: The hinges can pop up suddenly, so be careful.

lines.text: Then, remove the scanner cover to reveal the printing mechanism.
lines.text_raw: Then, remove the scanner cover to reveal the printing mechanism.

lines.text: Remove the screws on the cover.
lines.text_raw: Remove the screws on the cover.

lines.text: You will notice the speaker below the cover.
lines.text_raw: You will notice the speaker below the cover.

lines.text: Remove the screws holding the cartridge door. There is another slotted opto switch here.
lines.text_raw: Remove the screws holding the cartridge door. There is another slotted opto switch here.

lines.text: There is an extra weight block on the print mechanism to prevent vibration.
lines.text_raw: There is an extra weight block on the print mechanism to prevent vibration.

lines.text: Remove the red marked screw to detach the ink hose.
lines.text_raw: Remove the red marked screw to detach the ink hose.

lines.text: Remove the green marked screw to detach the ink cartridge slot.
lines.text_raw: Remove the green marked screw to detach the ink cartridge slot.

lines.text: Finally, we have the ink hose and the nozzles.
lines.text_raw: Finally, we have the ink hose and the nozzles.

lines.text: Remove the screws to detach the mainboard of the printer.
lines.text_raw: Remove the screws to detach the mainboard of the printer.

lines.text: The board has a power input, an Ethernet connector, a USB device port, phone line input and outputs, memory card slots, a USB host port, various internal connectors and a CR2032 RTC battery.
lines.text_raw: The board has a power input, an Ethernet connector, a USB device port, phone line input and outputs, memory card slots, a USB host port, various internal connectors and a CR2032 RTC battery.

lines.text: Remove the screws holding the print head's motor.
lines.text_raw: Remove the screws holding the print head's motor.

lines.text: And we have a DC motor here.
lines.text_raw: And we have a DC motor here.

lines.text: Rotate the printer right to reach the other DC motor.
lines.text_raw: Rotate the printer right to reach the other DC motor.

lines.text: Remove the two screws connecting the motor to the body.
lines.text_raw: Remove the two screws connecting the motor to the body.

lines.text: We will have another DC Motor.
lines.text_raw: We will have another DC Motor.

lines.text: Remove the screw to get the slotted opto switches.
lines.text_raw: Remove the screw to get the slotted opto switches.

lines.text: The L7580 has a lot of DC motors inside. Detach the ink cartridge slots by removing the screws to discover another DC motor.
lines.text_raw: The L7580 has a lot of DC motors inside. Detach the ink cartridge slots by removing the screws to discover another DC motor.

lines.text: This is the ink cartridge pumping mechanism. The last DC motor we detached controls this mechanism.
lines.text_raw: This is the ink cartridge pumping mechanism. The last DC motor we detached controls this mechanism.

lines.text: The opto switch reports the mechanism's position.
lines.text_raw: The opto switch reports the mechanism's position.

lines.text: Communication between the board and cartridges is being established by serial data line as I guess.
lines.text_raw: Communication between the board and cartridges is being established by serial data line as I guess.

lines.text: Then, we see here the print head cleaning mechanism.
lines.text_raw: Then, we see here the print head cleaning mechanism.

lines.text: The master print head (which includes two removable heads) has a circuit board inside.
lines.text_raw: The master print head (which includes two removable heads) has a circuit board inside.

lines.text: And this is the paper type detector. It has been compacted a bit when comparing to previous versions.
lines.text_raw: And this is the paper type detector. It has been compacted a bit when comparing to previous versions.

lines.text: Reaching to the bottom layer, this is the paper feeding mechanism.
lines.text_raw: Reaching to the bottom layer, this is the paper feeding mechanism.

lines.text: By removing the top cover, we discover the sixth and the last DC motor with its encoder.
lines.text_raw: By removing the top cover, we discover the sixth and the last DC motor with its encoder.

lines.text: At the final step, we discover an air pump for the print head cleaning mechanism. It's surprising!
lines.text_raw: At the final step, we discover an air pump for the print head cleaning mechanism. It's surprising!

guide.summary: Disassembling and discovering HP L7580 step by step.
guide.title: HP Officejet Pro L7580 Teardown
